titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Gelman Library Subject Specialist Program records, 1985-1999 RG0140

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Gelman Library Subject Specialist Program records
did.abstract: This collection contains files kept by George Washington University librarians Caroline Long, Dan Barthell, and Mary Faith Pankin concerning the Subject Specialist program at Gelman Library. Records date from 1985 to 1999, with the bulk dating between 1990 and 1998.
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Subject Specialist Program at Gelman Library was instituted by University Librarian Sharon Rogers, and ran from summer 1985 until summer 1999. All librarians had to do collection development, faculty liaison, and research consultations, and many taught classes. In 1991 the then-acting University Librarian Debbie Masters instituted the coordinator/team leader format. Caroline Long was then the chief coordinator and Dan Barthell and Mary Faith Pankin were, along with Caroline, the team leaders. All librarians who did not report to the University Librarian or to an Associate University Librarian reported to a team leader, as well as a functional supervisor. The team leader was in charge of performance appraisal, with input from the functional supervisor, and in charge of planning the hours that each person would spend on various activities. Liz Harter replaced Dan Barthell in this leadership role until 1999, when the library was reorganized.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection organized into one series: Files of Caroline Long, Dan Barthell, and Mary Faith Pankin.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Files are in their original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains files kept by George Washington University librarians Caroline Long, Dan Barthell, and Mary Faith Pankin concerning the Subject Specialist Program at Gelman Library. The program was instituted by University Librarian Sharon Rogers, and ran from summer 1985 until summer 1999. Records date from 1985 to 1999, with the bulk dating between 1990 and 1998.

did.unittitle: Files of Caroline Long, Dan Barthell, and Mary Faith Pankin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following inventory was provided by Mary Faith Pankin:

Files of Mary Faith: 1985-1989 Subject Specialist (SS) early documents SS 1991-92 SS Hours planning 1991-93 SS Hours planning, 1992 SS Hours planning, 1994 SS Hours planning, 1995 (2 folders) SS Hours planning1996/97 (3 folders) SS Hours planning, 1997/98 SS 1993 SS1994 SS1996/97 SS1997/98

Files of Caroline Long and Dan Barthell: SS Development model SS Mission SS Vision Teams Computer literacy Gurus SS meetings, 1991- Organizational structure Memos to SS Databases SS/OAG Open House Background information Meeting topics SS orientation SS coordinator 1989-1998 Pending questions Retreat, 1987-2 folders Retreat, 1998 Functional support Research report, 198-? Coordinator, 1989/90 SS meetings 1988/89
